title: Rig Veda
author: Unknown (Ancient Rishis)
description: The Rig Veda is one of the oldest scriptures, composed in Vedic Sanskrit. It contains hymns dedicated to various deities.

title: Bhagavad Gita
author: Vyasa
description: A 700-verse Hindu scripture that is part of the Mahabharata, offering spiritual wisdom and guidance.

title: Patanjali Yoga Sutras
author: Patanjali
description: A foundational text on the theory and practice of Yoga, detailing the eight limbs of Yoga.

title: Upanishads
author: Various Sages
description: Philosophical texts that explore the nature of reality and self-awareness, forming the basis of Vedanta.

title: Charaka Samhita
author: Charaka
description: An ancient text on Ayurveda that describes various medical treatments and holistic healing methods.

title: Sushruta Samhita
author: Sushruta
description: A classical Sanskrit text on medicine and surgery, detailing surgical techniques and treatments.

title: Surya Siddhanta
author: Unknown (Ancient Astronomers)
description: An ancient Sanskrit text on astronomy and mathematics, describing planetary motions.

title: Vaastu Shastra
author: Various
description: A traditional Indian system of architecture and design principles based on natural laws.

title: Arthashastra
author: Chanakya
description: A treatise on statecraft, economic policy, and military strategy in ancient India.

title: Ramayana
author: Valmiki
description: An epic poem narrating the life of Lord Rama, Sita, and their adventures.

title: Natya Shastra
author: Bharata Muni
description: An ancient text on performing arts, covering theatre, dance, and music.

title: Panchatantra
author: Vishnu Sharma
description: A collection of fables with moral lessons, widely regarded as one of the earliest works of storytelling.
